intro: Japanobotrychum cicutarium, commonly known as the Japanese burrweed, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and small yellow flowers. The plant produces numerous seeds enclosed in rough, bristly fruits that aid in its dispersal. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and urban settings.
